classification: Metalwork, Tools, Equipment and Utilitarian Objects
creditline: The Pflaum Silver Fund and the Decorative Arts Deaccession Fund
markings: at edge of foot and edge of cover, stamped: [G / (two upward-pointing arrows) / B] and unidentified stamp; at rim of goblet, stamped: [(man's head in profile)], unidentified stamp and [(rooster)]; on cross, stamped: unidentified stamp
text: In the Catholic church, a pyxis serves as a receptacle for the Blessed Host. The four cherub heads, which decorate its cover, allude to the divine content, but they also refer to the teaching, according to which the Mass on earth is mirrored by the divine liturgy of the angels in the parallel universe of heaven.
title: Travel pyxis
